DataElement.preferredName: BF-Diary Assessing OIC Past 24 Hours How Often Unable Have Bowel Movement Even Though Felt Had to Score Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often, in the past 24 hours, they were unable to have a bowel movement even though they felt like they had to, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation Past 24 Hours How Often Unable to Have Bowel Movement Even Though Felt Had to Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to capture relevant patient information regarding opioid-induced constipation in a clinical trial setting. Three modules record information on bowel movements, symptoms experienced, and treatments used to relieve constipation._The 24 hour period occurring just before the present time._A question about how often an individual was unable to have a bowel movement even though they felt like they had to._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation (BF-Diary)
Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: In the past 24 hours, how oft
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past 24 hours, how often were you unable to have a bowel movement even though you felt like you had to?
